title: CTRL0000082299 - Transcribed Interview of Enrique Alejandro de la Torre, (May 11, 2022)

data.text: SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE
JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES,
WASHINGTON, D.C.
DEPOSITION OF:
ENRIQUE ALEJANDRO DE LA TORRE
Wednesday, May 11, 2022
Washington, D.C.
The deposition in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 1:05 p.m.
Appearances:
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
SENIOR ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT
CHIEF CLERK
, SENIOR INVESTIGATIVE COUNSEL
For THE WITNESS:
MICHAEL BECKER
So we'll -- good afternoon.
Mr.
This is a deposition conducted by the House Select Committee to Investigate the
January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol, pursuant to House Resolution 503.
At this time, I'd ask the witness to please state and spell your name for the record.
Mr. de la Torre.
Enrique A. de la Torre, E-n-r-i-q-u-e, space bar, A., period, space
bar, d-e, space bar, I-a, space bar, T-o-r-r-e.
Mr.-
Thank you, Mr. de la Torre.
Could you please place raise hand so you can be sworn in for the deposition?
The Reporter.
Do you solemnly declare and affirm under the penalty of perjury
that the testimony you are about to give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing
but the truth?
Mr. de la Torre.
Mr.~
My name is
Yes.
Mr. de la Torre, you can put your right hand down.
January 6th Select Committee.
I'm a Senior Investigative Counsel on the staff of the
This will be a staff-led deposition that is led by me.
Members of the select committee may choose to join us.
can also ask questions as well.
And I don't expect any will for today.
And if they do so, they
But, as we stand here now, no members have joined us.
Otherwise, joining me by Webex, as you've seen, we have an official reporter.
And then there are also staff members on the -- on the select committee.
Now we'll follow today the House deposition rules that we've provided to your
counsel previously with the subpoena that came to you.
permitted to have an attorney present, which I see you do.
Thank you.
And, under those rules, you are
So, at this time, I'd ask for your attorney, Mr. Becker, to please identify himself for
the record and spell his last name for us.
Mr. Becker.
M r . - Under the House deposition rules, neither committee members nor
staff may discuss the substance of your testimony that you provide today, Mr. de la Torre,
unless the committee approves release.
review the transcript at a later date once it's complete.
You and Mr. Becker will have an opportunity to
Before we begin, though, I'd like to describe just a few grounds rules and see if
Michael David Becker, B-e-c-k-e-r.
you or Mr. Becker have any questions.
There is an official reporter, as you've noted and I've discussed, who will be
transcribing the record of this deposition.
Please wait until each question is completed
that I ask before you begin your response, and I'll wait for you to complete your answer
before I ask my next question.
The reporter can't record nonverbal responses such as shaking or nodding your
head.
And excuse me in advance if I have to follow up and ask you to do that if you forget.
So we ask that you please respond with a yes, no, or otherwise a verbal response.
If you spell something we don't know the spelling to, I might ask you to spell that.
That's simply for the benefit of the record.
And all we ask of you today, as with any witness, is that you provide complete
answers based on your best recollection.
my best to rephrase it.
If the question is not clear, just say so.
I'll do
And if you don't know the answer, simply say so.
Now you may only refuse to answer a question to preserve a privilege recognized
by the select committee.
If you refuse to answer a question based on a privilege, staff,
that is, myself, may seek a ruling from the chairman of the select committee on the
objection or proceed with the deposition and, otherwise, keep asking questions and seek
a ruling from the chairman at a later date.
If the chairman overrules your objection either today or at a later date, you are
required to answer the question or questions.
I also want to remind you, as we do all witnesses, that it is unlawful to deliberately
provide false information to Congress.
And, since this deposition is under oath,
providing false information could result in criminal penalties to include for perjury and/or
providing false statements.
Do you understand all of the grounds rules that I've just discussed?
Mr. de la Torre.
Mr.-
Now, Mr. de la Torre, earlier this week, Mr. Becker wrote me to inform the select
Yes.
Excuse me for a moment.
committee that you are declining to produce any documents or answer any questions
pursuant to the Fifth Amendment.
Is that correct as a general matter?
Mr. de la Torre.
Mr.-
Yes.
Be that as it may, we're going to proceed today with questions
relevant to the select committee's investigate with the hope that you will answer.
If you have a privilege assertion, such as the Fifth, please assert it for the record in
response to each question as appropriate.
I'll say at the outset that the Fifth Amendment provides a witness the ability to
refuse to answer a question against himself or herself if they have a reasonable belief
that a truthful answer would tend to incriminate them, not simply because you would
prefer not to answer the question.
Do you understand that?
Mr. de la Torre.
Yes.
EXAMINATION
BYMR.-
Q
How old are you, Mr. de la Torre?
A
On the advice of counsel, I'm invoking my right to the Fifth Amendment of
the Constitution of the United States.
Q
In what State do you reside?
A
On the advice of counsel, I'm invoking my right to the Fifth Amendment of
the Constitution of the United States.
Q
What's your highest level of education?
A
On the advice of counsel, I am invoking my right to the Fifth Amendment of
the United States.
Q
For the benefit of the record and brevity, if Mr. Becker and you agree, Mr. de
la Torre, I am comfortable with you just simply saying "the Fifth" in response to the
questions.
But it's up to you.
Is that okay?
A
Okay.
Q
Have you ever worked for Roger Stone?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Are you currently employed by Roger Stone?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Have you discussed with Roger Stone the fact that he was subpoenaed by
the January 6th Select Committee?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
And that Mr. Stone refused to provide documents or answer questions while
asserting his rights under the Fifth Amendment?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
To your knowledge, is Mr. Stone under investigation by the FBI or
Department of Justice in connection with the January 6th attack on the Capitol?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Has the FBI or the Department of Justice sought to interview you in
connection with their investigation of the January 6th attack on the Capitol?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Do you have any reason to believe you are under investigation by the FBI or
the Department of Justice in connection with the January 6th attack on the Capitol?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
In connection with the events of January 6th, Roger Stone has repeatedly
said publicly that, quote, "Roger Stone did nothing wrong," close quote.
Are you aware of that?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
To your knowledge, did Roger Stone do anything wrong in connection with
the events of January 6th and the attack on the Capitol?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Have you discussed with Roger Stone the fact that you were subpoenaed by
the January 6th Select Committee?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
Did Mr. Stone tell you to refuse to provide documents or answer questions
based on the Fifth Amendment?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
Now I don't want to know anything about any conversations that you have
had with your attorney, Mr. Becker, or any other attorneys you've worked with on this
matter.
Putting that aside, did anyone else tell you to refuse to provide documents or
answer questions with the select committee based on the Fifth Amendment?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
You've been described in public reporting as having worked for Roger Stone
at least in the years 2020 and 2021.
Is that correct?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
What did your work for Roger Stone during the years 2020 and 2021
generally entail?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did your work for Roger Stone at any point during those years involve issues
related to the 2020 Presidential election?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
In the course of your interactions with Roger Stone, did he ever discuss his
views on actions President Trump should take with respect to the 2020 Presidential
election?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
Is it correct that, during 2020 and continuing through in and around Jan of
2021, that Roger Stone permitted two Danish filmmakers to film him for a documentary?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
It has been publicly reported that, during this time, the Danish filmmakers
recorded interactions between you and Mr. Stone.
Did those filmmakers film you and Mr. Stone together?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
It has been publicly reported that the filmmakers recorded Mr. Stone telling
you on or about July 9th of 2020 that, in sum and substance, President Trump should use
the powers of his office to reject official results in that year's upcoming Presidential
election and secure victory in the courts with help from Federal judges who are loyal to
him.
Did Mr. Stone say that to you?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
The public reporting on that incident also goes on to say that, in the
presence of the filmmakers, Roger Stone told you, among other things, that the 2020
Presidential election would be, quote, "really nasty," close quote and that Democrats
would try to steal the election from President Trump.
Did Mr. Stone say that to you?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Prior to the 2020 Presidential election, did Roger Stone undertake any
efforts to support President Trump's reelection campaign?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did you work with him on those efforts?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Prior to the 2020 Presidential election, did Roger Stone communicate with
President Trump about strategy for the 2020 Presidential election?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did Mr. Stone during that time communicate with anyone in the White
House about strategy for the 2020 Presidential election?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
And, during that same time, did Mr. Stone communicate with anyone in
President Trump's reelection campaign about strategy for the 2020 Presidential election?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
It has been publicly reported that, on or about November 5th of 2020, 2 days
after the Presidential election, that Roger Stone relaunched the, quote, "stop the steal,"
close, quote, campaign.
Is that correct?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
It has been further publicly reported that, on or about that same day, that is,
November 5th of 2020, in the presence of the Danish filmmakers, Roger Stone drafted a
"stop the steal" action plan on your computer.
Did Mr. Stone draft such an action plan on your computer?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
That "stop the steal" action plan has been described as saying that, as
protesters were mobilized, State lawmakers would be lobbied to reject official results of
the 2020 Presidential election.
Is that correct?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
Do you still have that "stop the steal" action plan or a copy of that action
plan in your possession, custody, or control?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
Who was the "stop the steal" action plan directed to?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
With whom did Roger Stone share the "stop the steal" action plan?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
Who did you share the action plan with?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
It has been further publicly reported that, on or about November 5th of
2020, Roger Stone discussed the "stop the steal" campaign with General Michael Flynn
and the need for them to coordinate with the White House going forward.
Is that reporting correct?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
What role did General Flynn play with respect to the "stop the steal"
campaign?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Between on or about November 5th of 2020 and January 20th, 2021, when
President Trump left office, did Roger Stone communicate with President Trump about
the 2020 Presidential election?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
Now Roger Stone has stated publicly that, on December 27th of 2020, he
met with President Trump at President Trump's golf club in West Palm Beach, Florida, and
discussed how President Trump could still win the 2020 Presidential election.
Did Mr. Stone share with you the particulars of his conversation with President
Trump on December 27th?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
Between on or about November 5th of 2020 and January 20th of 2021, did
Mr. Roger Stone communicate with anyone in the White House other than President
Trump about the 2020 Presidential election?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
During that same time period, that is, after the election and before President
Trump left office, did Roger Stone communicate with anyone in President Trump's
reelection campaign about the 2020 Presidential election?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
It has been further publicly reported that, on or about November 5th of
2020, Roger Stone made the decision to begin raising money for the "stop the steal"
campaign.
Is that accurate?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
In between on or about November 5th of 2020 and January 20th of 2021,
what method or methods did Roger Stone use to raise money for the "stop the steal"
campaign?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Approximately how much money did he raise?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
To what use or uses did he put the money he raised?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did Mr. Stone pay you for your work generally for him?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did he pay you for your work on the "stop the steal" campaign specifically?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
How did he pay you?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Other than General Michael Flynn, I'm going to ask you about a series of
people.
November 5th of 2020 and January 20th of 2021 in connection with the "stop the steal"
campaign?
And the question is this:
Did Mr. Stone work with them between on or about
So I'll ask that question with respect to Ali Alexander, also known as Ali Akbar.
Did he work with him on the "stop the steal" campaign?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Alex Jones.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Owen Shroyer.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Kristin Davis.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Jacob Engels.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Salvatore, or Sal, Greco.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Enrique Tarrio of the Proud Boys.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to any other member or members that you
That's S-h-r-o-y-e-r.
knew to be with the Proud Boys.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Elmer Stewart Rhodes of the Oath Keepers.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
And same question with respect to any other member or members that you
knew to be affiliated with the Oath Keepers.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
It has been reported publicly that Roger Stone appeared at various "stop the
steal" related events between November 5th of 2020 and January 6th of 2021.
Is that correct?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did you attend any of these events with Mr. Stone?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
It has been reported publicly that Roger Stone spoke to a crowd in
Washington, D.C., the night of December 11th, 2020, and he did so while in the company
of Owen Shroyer, Enrique Tarrio, and Ethan Nordean, Mr. Nordean, like Mr. Tarrio, being
a member of the Proud Boys.
Is that accurate to your knowledge?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Were you in Washington D.C. on December 11th of 2020 with Mr. Stone?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
What is the nature of Mr. Stone's relationship with the Proud Boys?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
How about with respect to Mr. Enrique Tarrio in particular?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Mr. Ethan Nordean.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Would members of the Proud Boys provide Mr. Stone personal security at
events at which he appeared?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
It has been reported publicly, and Roger Stone himself has acknowledged,
that he was in Washington, D.C., for protest events on January 5th and January 6th of
Do you know that to be true?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
What role did Roger Stone have with respect to planning the protest events
in Washington, D.C., on January 5th and 6th of 2021?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Do you know a woman named Julie Fancelli?
That's F-a-n-c-e-1-1-i.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Does Roger Stone know Ms. Fancelli?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
What is the nature of Ms. Fancelli's relationship with Roger Stone?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Has Ms. Fancelli provided financial support to Mr. Stone?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
It's been publicly reported that Ms. Fancelli donated money to pay for the
protest event at which President Trump spoke on January 6th of 2021 on The Ellipse.
Did Roger Stone work with Ms. Fancelli on planning for that event?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did Ms. Fancelli pay for a private airplane to fly Roger Stone and others to
and from Washington, D.C., for the events in the city on January 5th and 6th of 2021?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Were you in Washington, D.C., on January 5th or 6th of 2021?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Was Kristin Davis in Washington, D.C., with Mr. Stone on January 5th and 6th
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Salvatore, or Sal, Greco.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Same question with respect to Jake Engels.
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
It's been publicly reported, and Mr. Stone has himself acknowledged, that he
used members of the Oath Keepers to provide him personal security at several "stop the
steal" protests events.
Do you know how Mr. Stone first began working with the Oath Keepers?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
What is the nature of Mr. Stone's relationship with Elmer Stewart Rhodes,
the founder of the Oath Keepers?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
It has been reported publicly, and Roger Stone has himself acknowledged,
that several members of the Oath Keepers provided personal security for him while he
was in Washington, D.C., on January 5th and 6th of 2021.
Do you know how Mr. Stone came to have Oath Keepers providing him security
for those days?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Several of those Oath Keepers have been charged in connection with their
storming the Capitol on January 6th of 2021 to include a charge of seditious conspiracy.
Have you talked with Mr. Stone about that fact?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
What has he told you?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Have you talked with Roger Stone more broadly about what he did while he
was in Washington, D.C., on January 5th and 6th of 2021?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did Roger Stone have any role in planning the attack on the Capitol on
January 6th of 2021?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
It has been reported publicly, and the Danish filmmakers recorded, that up
until the time that President Trump left office, Roger Stone was advocating for President
Trump to pardon several people.
Did you help Roger Stone in these efforts?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did he discuss these efforts with you?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did Roger Stone ask President Trump for a pardon for his, that is, Roger
Stone's, efforts in connection with challenging the results of the 2020 Presidential
election?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment rights.
Q
Did Roger Stone ask President Trump for a pardon for his, that is, Roger
Stone's, actions with respect to the events of January 6th of 2021?
A
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Mr.-
I'll note for the record that, at this point, Mr. de la Torre has
asserted the Fifth Amendment privilege as a basis to refuse to answer all of the select
committee's substantive questions.
Mr. de la Torre, is it your intention to assert your Fifth Amendment privilege to
any additional questions that I would ask you?
Mr. de la Torre.
Mr.-
I assert my Fifth Amendment right.
Under these circumstances, we will not close the record on the
deposition.
As I explained at the outset, when a witness such as yourself refuses to answer a
question based on the assertion of the privilege, as you've done today, it is the
prerogative of the select committee to proceed with the questioning and seek a ruling
from the chairman on the privilege assertions at a later date.
So, at this time, we'll hold the deposition in recess, Mr. de la Torre, subject to the
call of the chairman, in order to potentially seek a ruling on your privilege assertions.
Of course, we will provide you appropriate notice if and when the chairman seeks
to resume the deposition after he's ruled on the objection or, rather, the privilege
assertion.
But for now the deposition is in recess, and we'll go off the record.
[Whereupon, at 1:27 p.m., the deposition was recessed, subject to the call of the
chair.]
Thank you.
Certificate of Deponent/Interviewee
I have read the foregoing _ _ pages, which contain the correct transcript of the
answers made by me to the questions therein recorded.
Witness Name
Date
